capstone.game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • capstone.game.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Main entrance point of the program, manages dispatchment of the levels (the actual UI) and acts as the layer between the environment/system and the game by mapping key-presses to player and handing them over to the Level class, which handles the game logic. The Game class is also responsible for managing the frame-rate, which is the basic unit of time used by the system. The frame-rate corresponds to how often the game is updated per second, i.e. how often accumulated user-presses are transferred to the level to move the players. It also controls at what rate dynamic obstacles move (which, however, is also influenced by the difficulty of the game).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Defaults the frame-rate to 10 Hz, i.e. 10 updates per second.

      • Game

        public Game(double frameRate)
        Constructs the Game with the given frameRate
        Parameters:
        frameRate - How often to update the game per second (in Hertz).

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public void play()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Executes the full cycle of setting up the game, looping until the game is lost or won, and then storing the result and stopping the screen.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for various file I/O.

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Sets up the game for playing by opening the various setup windows, such as for selecting profiles, themes, levels, session etc.

      • loop

        public void loop()
        Main event-loop. Basically accumulates key-presses and maps the to the respective players (if possible) and once a frame has timed-out sends those key-presses to the game for processing.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the screen.

      • backToStart

        public void backToStart()
        Utility method to setup the level and restart the watch. Used by the menu to go back to the start.

      • save

        public void save()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the level at its current state.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of file I/O badness.

      • frameRate

        public double frameRate()
        Returns:
        The current framerate of the game.

      • _endGame

        private void _endGame()
        Ends the game by showing a result message-box (Success/Lost) and stores the highscore if the game was won. Then goes right back to the start screen.

      • _createScreen

        private com.googlecode.lanterna.screen.Screen _createScreen()
        Returns:
        A new Screen (between Terminal and GUIScreen) for the game.

      • _getProfiles

        private java.util.List<Profile> _getProfiles()
        Manages retrieving the profiles for the game by showing the relevant UI window. Finally fills the keymap for mapping key-presses to profiles.
        Returns:
        A list or registered profiles.

      • _fillKeyMap

        private void _fillKeyMap(java.util.Collection<Profile> profiles)
        Fills the _keyMap field with each key of every player mapped to their profile, such that you can lookup a player's profile in O(1) from a new keypress.
        Parameters:
        profiles - The profiles collected previously

      • _getLevel

        private Level _getLevel()
        Loads a level from the LevelWindow UI.
        Returns:
        The level to be executed.

      • _storeHighscore

        private void _storeHighscore(double time)
        Stores a new entry for the players in the highscore associated with the game. Creates a new highscore object/file if none exists yet for this level, else adds it to the old one. Note that only successes are stored.
        Parameters:
        time - The elapsed time for the last game.

      • _getHighscore

        private Highscore _getHighscore(double time)
        Helper method of _storeHighscore to retrieve a new highscore object (does what _storeHighscore says).
        Parameters:
        time - The elapsed time for the last game.
        Returns:
        A Highscore object, either newly created or from an existing file.

      • _handleInput

        private void _handleInput(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Direction> directions)
        Manages keypress input. The escape key opens the menu, the backspace key is a shortcut to the legend. Other keys may be user keys or simply noise.
        Parameters:
        directions - The Map from ids to directions to add a potential player key-press too.

      • _processKey

        private void _processKey(com.googlecode.lanterna.input.Key raw,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Direction> directions)
        Attempts to match a key to a player.
        Parameters:
        raw - A lanterna key object. "raw" because it is used to construct a superior InputKey object (e.g. better equals support).
        directions - The map from ids to directions.
